page.title: 18S.CROYDON _ ENVIRONMENT
page.content: The area as a whole is well looked after,having plenty of greenery around.Even in the more built_up areas in the west of the Block there is usually a view of some trees or grass to be seen. The eastern parts often give the impression of being in the open countryside because there is so little built_up environment. Possibly because of the open spaces and the hilly nature of the area ,and because there is no part that has really bad housing problems, there is not too much evidence of environmental pollution.There are no major building works which dominate the area, the main form of building being redevelopment on fairly small sites where large,old houses have been pulled down.
